title: Snake causes power outage in Fla. county
content:
CLAY COUNTY, Fla. — A snake has been deemed the culprit behind a power outage that left over 5,000 customers in the dark for almost an hour Tuesday night, according to Clay Electric Cooperative. 

The outage was reported about 10:30 p.m. in Oakleaf and areas of Argyle. 

The snake caused an arc flash when it crawled across a transformer tie-breaker, taking two transformers in the substation out of service and causing outages on five feeder lines, Clay Electric manager of communications Wayne Mattox told First Coast News. 

Orange Park District Line Supervisor Don Clark said rain can make snakes look for higher ground and it's not unusual for reptiles to occasionally come in contact with the cooperative's equipment. 

Crews will check the substation Wednesday to see if any repairs are necessary.
